intro: Hybanthus parviflorus f. microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved hybanthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, pale blue or white flowers. The plant is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value is due to its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
